member.name: T:RedisResp.ClientConnectedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for events raised when a client connects to the server.
member.remarks: This event argument class contains information about a newly connected client, including the unique client identifier, remote endpoint, and connection timestamp. It is used by the ClientConnected event in the RespListener.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientConnectedEventArgs.GUID
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier for the connected client.
member.value: A GUID uniquely identifying the client session.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientConnectedEventArgs.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the remote endpoint information of the connected client.
member.value: The IP address and port of the client connection.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientConnectedEventArgs.ConnectedUtc
member.summary: Gets or sets the timestamp when the client connected.
member.value: The UTC timestamp of the connection establishment.

member.name: T:RedisResp.ClientDisconnectedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for events raised when a client disconnects from the server.
member.remarks: This event argument class contains information about a disconnected client, including the client identifier, reason for disconnection, remote endpoint, and disconnection timestamp. It is used by the ClientDisconnected event in the RespListener.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientDisconnectedEventArgs.GUID
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the disconnected client.
member.value: The GUID that identified the client session.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientDisconnectedEventArgs.Reason
member.summary: Gets or sets the reason for the client disconnection.
member.value: A descriptive string explaining why the client disconnected.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientDisconnectedEventArgs.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the remote endpoint information of the disconnected client.
member.value: The IP address and port of the client connection.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientDisconnectedEventArgs.DisconnectedAt
member.summary: Gets or sets the timestamp when the client disconnected.
member.value: The UTC timestamp of the disconnection.

member.name: T:RedisResp.ClientInfo
member.summary: Contains information about a connected client.
member.remarks: This class stores all relevant information about a client connection, including the unique identifier, TCP client connection, and remote endpoint. It is used internally by RespListener for client management.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientInfo.GUID
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier for the client.
member.value: A GUID uniquely identifying the client session.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientInfo.TcpClient
member.summary: Gets or sets the TCP client connection.
member.value: The underlying TcpClient connection.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientInfo.RemoteEndPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the remote endpoint information of the client.
member.value: The IP address and port of the client connection.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientInfo.ConnectedUtc
member.summary: Gets or sets the timestamp when the client connected.
member.value: The UTC timestamp of the connection establishment.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ClientInfo.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the client name as set by the CLIENT SETNAME command.
member.value: The name assigned to the client, or null if no name has been set.

member.name: M:RedisResp.ClientInfo.#ctor(System.Guid,System.Net.Sockets.TcpClient,System.Net.IPEndPoint)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The unique identifier for the client.
The TCP client connection.
The remote endpoint of the client.
member.exception: Thrown when tcpClient or remoteEndPoint is null.
member.remarks: Creates a new client info instance with the specified connection details. The connected timestamp is automatically set to the current UTC time.

member.name: T:RedisResp.ErrorEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for events raised when an error occurs in the server.
member.remarks: This event argument class contains information about server or client errors, including the error message, underlying exception, and associated client ID if applicable. It is used by the ErrorOccurred event in the RespListener.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ErrorEventArgs.Message
member.summary: Gets or sets the error message describing what went wrong.
member.value: A human-readable description of the error.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ErrorEventArgs.Exception
member.summary: Gets or sets the exception that caused the error, if any.
member.value: The underlying exception, or null if no exception was thrown.

member.name: P:RedisResp.ErrorEventArgs.GUID
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of the client associated with the error.
member.value: The client GUID if the error is client-specific, or null for server-wide errors.

member.name: T:RedisResp.RedisValue
member.summary: Base class for all Redis value types.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RedisValue.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of this Redis value.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RedisValue.ExpiresAt
member.summary: Gets or sets the expiration time for this value.
member.value: The expiration time in UTC, or null if no expiration is set.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RedisValue.IsExpired
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this value has expired.
member.value: True if the value has expired; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RedisValue.GetTtl
member.summary: Gets the Time To Live (TTL) for this value in seconds.
member.returns: The TTL in seconds, -1 if no expiration is set, or -2 if expired.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RedisValue.SetExpiration(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the expiration time for this value.
member.param: The number of seconds until expiration.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RedisValue.RemoveExpiration
member.summary: Removes the expiration time from this value.

member.name: T:RedisResp.RedisValueType
member.summary: Enumeration of Redis value types.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RedisValueType.String
member.summary: String value type.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RedisValueType.Hash
member.summary: Hash value type.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RedisValueType.List
member.summary: List value type.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RedisValueType.Set
member.summary: Set value type.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RedisValueType.SortedSet
member.summary: Sorted set value type.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RedisValueType.Json
member.summary: JSON value type.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RedisValueType.Stream
member.summary: Stream value type.

member.name: T:RedisResp.RespDataReceivedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for events raised when RESP data is received.
member.remarks: This event argument class contains all the information about a received RESP protocol message, including the parsed data type, the actual value, raw protocol data, and timestamp. It is used by all RESP data type events in the RespListener.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespDataReceivedEventArgs.DataType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of RESP data that was received.
member.value: The RESP data type enumeration value.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespDataReceivedEventArgs.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the parsed value of the received data.
member.value: The parsed data value. Type varies based on DataType: - SimpleString/Error: string - Integer: long or string (if parsing failed) - BulkString: string - Array: object with Length and Data properties - Null: null

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespDataReceivedEventArgs.RawData
member.summary: Gets or sets the raw RESP protocol data as received.
member.value: The unparsed raw data string including RESP protocol markers.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespDataReceivedEventArgs.Timestamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the timestamp when the data was received.
member.value: The UTC timestamp of when the data was processed.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespDataReceivedEventArgs.ClientGUID
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the client that sent the data.
member.value: The GUID of the client that sent the RESP data.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespDataReceivedEventArgs.RawBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the raw binary data for bulk strings.
member.value: The original binary data before string conversion, used to preserve binary content.
member.remarks: This is only populated for BulkString data types to preserve binary data integrity.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespDataReceivedEventArgs.MessageBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the complete unmolested message bytes as received from the network.
member.value: The original binary message data including all RESP protocol markers and terminators.
member.remarks: Contains the complete raw message bytes for all data types, useful for protocol analysis and debugging.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespDataReceivedEventArgs.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the RESP protocol version used to parse this message.
member.value: The RESP protocol version (RESP2 or RESP3) that was used to parse this message.
member.remarks: This indicates which protocol parsing logic was used for this message. RESP2 supports basic data types, while RESP3 includes enhanced data types.

member.name: T:RedisResp.RespDataType
member.summary: Represents the different data types supported by the Redis Serialization Protocol (RESP).
member.remarks: RESP is a serialization protocol used by Redis for client-server communication. Each data type is identified by a specific first character in the protocol.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.SimpleString
member.summary: Simple string data type (prefix: +). Used for simple status replies like "OK".

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.Error
member.summary: Error data type (prefix: -). Used to represent error messages from the server.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.Integer
member.summary: Integer data type (prefix: :). Used for signed 64-bit integers.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.BulkString
member.summary: Bulk string data type (prefix: $). Used for binary-safe strings with explicit length.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.Array
member.summary: Array data type (prefix: *). Used for ordered collections of RESP elements.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.Null
member.summary: Null data type. Represents null values in bulk strings or arrays.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.Double
member.summary: Double data type (prefix: ,). Used for floating-point numbers in RESP3.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.Boolean
member.summary: Boolean data type (prefix: #). Used for true/false values in RESP3.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.BigNumber
member.summary: BigNumber data type (prefix: (). Used for arbitrary precision numbers in RESP3.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.BlobError
member.summary: BlobError data type (prefix: !). Used for binary-safe error messages in RESP3.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.VerbatimString
member.summary: VerbatimString data type (prefix: =). Used for strings with encoding information in RESP3.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.Map
member.summary: Map data type (prefix: %). Used for key-value pairs in RESP3.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.Set
member.summary: Set data type (prefix: ~). Used for unordered collections in RESP3.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.Attribute
member.summary: Attribute data type (prefix: |). Used for metadata attributes in RESP3.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespDataType.Push
member.summary: Push data type (prefix: >). Used for server-initiated push messages in RESP3.

member.name: T:RedisResp.RespInterface
member.summary: Provides a higher-level interface for handling RESP protocol messages with both event-driven and functional approaches.
member.remarks: This class wraps a RespListener instance and provides multiple ways to handle RESP protocol messages: - Traditional event handlers (re-exposed from RespListener) - Functional handlers using Func, Action, and EventHandler properties This dual approach allows for flexible message handling based on application needs.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.SimpleStringReceived
member.summary: Raised when a simple string (prefix: +) is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.ErrorReceived
member.summary: Raised when an error message (prefix: -) is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.IntegerReceived
member.summary: Raised when an integer value (prefix: :) is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.BulkStringReceived
member.summary: Raised when a bulk string (prefix: $) is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.ArrayReceived
member.summary: Raised when an array (prefix: *) is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.NullReceived
member.summary: Raised when a null value is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.DataReceived
member.summary: Raised when any RESP data is received from a client, regardless of type.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.ClientConnected
member.summary: Raised when a new client connects to the server.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.ClientDisconnected
member.summary: Raised when a client disconnects from the server.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.ErrorOccurred
member.summary: Raised when an error occurs in the server or during client handling.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.DoubleReceived
member.summary: Raised when a double value (prefix: ,) is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.BooleanReceived
member.summary: Raised when a boolean value (prefix: #) is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.BigNumberReceived
member.summary: Raised when a big number value (prefix: () is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.BlobErrorReceived
member.summary: Raised when a blob error (prefix: !) is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.VerbatimStringReceived
member.summary: Raised when a verbatim string (prefix: =) is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.MapReceived
member.summary: Raised when a map (prefix: %) is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.SetReceived
member.summary: Raised when a set (prefix: ~) is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.AttributeReceived
member.summary: Raised when an attribute (prefix: |) is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespInterface.PushReceived
member.summary: Raised when a push message (prefix: >) is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespInterface.SimpleStringHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the functional handler for simple string messages.
member.value: A function that takes RespDataReceivedEventArgs and returns a response string, or null if no handler is set.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespInterface.ErrorHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the functional handler for error messages.
member.value: A function that takes RespDataReceivedEventArgs and returns a response string, or null if no handler is set.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespInterface.IntegerHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the functional handler for integer messages.
member.value: A function that takes RespDataReceivedEventArgs and returns a response string, or null if no handler is set.

member.summary: Gets or sets the functional handler for bulk string messages.
member.value: A function that takes RespDataReceivedEventArgs and returns a response string, or null if no handler is set.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespInterface.ArrayHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the functional handler for array messages.
member.value: A function that takes RespDataReceivedEventArgs and returns a response string, or null if no handler is set.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespInterface.NullHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the functional handler for null messages.
member.value: A function that takes RespDataReceivedEventArgs and returns a response string, or null if no handler is set.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespInterface.DataHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the functional handler for all data messages.
member.value: A function that takes RespDataReceivedEventArgs and returns a response string, or null if no handler is set.

member.summary: Gets or sets the action handler for client connection events.

member.summary: Gets or sets the action handler for client disconnection events.

member.summary: Gets or sets the action handler for error events.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespInterface.SimpleStringEventHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the event handler for simple string messages.
member.value: An EventHandler for RespDataReceivedEventArgs, or null if no handler is set.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespInterface.ErrorEventHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the event handler for error messages.
member.value: An EventHandler for RespDataReceivedEventArgs, or null if no handler is set.

member.summary: Gets or sets the event handler for integer messages.

member.summary: Gets or sets the event handler for array messages.

member.summary: Gets or sets the event handler for null messages.
member.value: An EventHandler for RespDataReceivedEventArgs, or null if no handler is set.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespInterface.DataEventHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the event handler for all data messages.

member.summary: Gets or sets the event handler for client connection events.

member.summary: Gets or sets the event handler for client disconnection events.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespInterface.Authenticate
member.summary: Gets or sets the authentication function that is called when a client attempts to authenticate.
member.value: A function that takes username and password parameters and returns true if authentication succeeds, or null if no authentication is required.
member.remarks: If this function is not set (null), all authentication attempts will be allowed by default. The function receives the username (or null for password-only AUTH) and password as parameters. Return true to allow the authentication, false to deny it.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespInterface.Listener
member.summary: Gets the underlying RespListener instance.
member.value: The RespListener instance used for RESP protocol handling.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RespInterface.#ctor(RedisResp.RespListener)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The RespListener instance to wrap and manage.
member.remarks: Creates a new RespInterface that wraps the provided RespListener and subscribes to all its events, providing both traditional event handling and functional handling approaches.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RespInterface.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .
member.remarks: This method disposes of the underlying RespListener and unsubscribes from all events. After calling this method, the instance cannot be reused.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RespInterface.OnSimpleStringReceived(System.Object,RedisResp.RespDataReceivedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles simple string received events from the underlying RespListener.
member.param: The event sender.
The event data containing the simple string information.

member.summary: Handles error received events from the underlying RespListener.

member.name: T:RedisResp.RespListener
member.summary: A TCP server that listens for and parses Redis Serialization Protocol (RESP) messages. Provides event-driven notification for different types of RESP data and client connections.
member.remarks: This class implements a multi-client TCP server that can parse RESP protocol messages and raise appropriate events based on the data type received. It supports all standard RESP data types including simple strings, errors, integers, bulk strings, arrays, and null values.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.SimpleStringReceived
member.summary: Raised when a simple string (prefix: +) is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.ErrorReceived
member.summary: Raised when an error message (prefix: -) is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.IntegerReceived
member.summary: Raised when an integer value (prefix: :) is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.BulkStringReceived
member.summary: Raised when a bulk string (prefix: $) is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.ArrayReceived
member.summary: Raised when an array (prefix: *) is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.NullReceived
member.summary: Raised when a null value is received from a client.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.DoubleReceived
member.summary: Raised when a double value is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.BooleanReceived
member.summary: Raised when a boolean value is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.BigNumberReceived
member.summary: Raised when a big number value is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.BlobErrorReceived
member.summary: Raised when a blob error is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.VerbatimStringReceived
member.summary: Raised when a verbatim string is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.MapReceived
member.summary: Raised when a map is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.SetReceived
member.summary: Raised when a set is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.AttributeReceived
member.summary: Raised when an attribute is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.PushReceived
member.summary: Raised when a push message is received from a client (RESP3).

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.DataReceived
member.summary: Raised when any RESP data is received from a client, regardless of type.
member.remarks: This is a generic event that fires for all data types. Use this for logging or monitoring all incoming data without subscribing to individual type events.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.ClientConnected
member.summary: Raised when a new client connects to the server.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.ClientDisconnected
member.summary: Raised when a client disconnects from the server.

member.name: E:RedisResp.RespListener.ErrorOccurred
member.summary: Raised when an error occurs in the server or during client handling.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespListener.IsListening
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the server is currently listening for connections.
member.value: true if the server is listening; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespListener.ConnectedClientsCount
member.summary: Gets the current number of connected clients.
member.value: The count of active client connections.
member.remarks: This property is thread-safe.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RespListener.RetrieveClients
member.summary: Gets information about all currently connected clients.
member.returns: An array of ClientInfo objects representing all connected clients.
member.remarks: This method returns a snapshot of all connected clients at the time of the call. The returned array is thread-safe and will not be modified by the server.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RespListener.RetrieveClientByGuid(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets information about a specific client by its GUID.
member.param: The GUID of the client to retrieve.
member.returns: The ClientInfo object for the specified client, or null if not found.
member.remarks: This method is thread-safe and returns null if the specified client is not connected.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RespListener.DisconnectClientByGuid(System.Guid)
member.summary: Disconnects a specific client by its GUID.
member.param: The GUID of the client to disconnect.
member.returns: true if the client was found and disconnected; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method gracefully disconnects the specified client and removes it from the connected clients collection. A ClientDisconnected event will be raised.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespListener.Logger
member.summary: Method to invoke to send log messages.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RespListener.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The port number to listen on. Defaults to 6379 (standard Redis port).
member.remarks: The server will listen on all available network interfaces (IPAddress.Any). Call to begin accepting client connections.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RespListener.StartAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Starts the server and begins listening for client connections asynchronously.
member.param: Cancellation token.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous start operation.
member.exception: Thrown if the server is already listening.
Thrown if the port is already in use or other socket errors occur.
member.remarks: This method starts the TCP listener and begins accepting client connections in the background. The method returns immediately after starting the listener; client connections are handled asynchronously.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RespListener.Stop
member.summary: Stops the server and disconnects all clients.
member.remarks: This method stops accepting new connections, closes all existing client connections, and stops the TCP listener. All connected clients will be disconnected gracefully.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RespListener.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .
member.remarks: This method stops the server if it's running and disposes of the TCP listener. After calling this method, the instance cannot be reused.

member.name: T:RedisResp.RespParseResult
member.summary: Represents the result of parsing a RESP message.
member.remarks: This class encapsulates the parsed message data along with metadata about the parsing operation, including the original raw data, the number of bytes consumed during parsing, and optionally the raw bytes from bulk string content for binary data preservation.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespParseResult.Message
member.summary: Gets or sets the parsed message object.
member.value: The message object extracted from the RESP data, which can be a string, integer, array, or null.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespParseResult.RawData
member.summary: Gets or sets the raw RESP data string.
member.value: The original RESP protocol string that was parsed.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespParseResult.RawBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the raw bytes from bulk string content.
member.value: The binary data extracted from bulk strings, or null if the message doesn't contain bulk string data.

member.name: P:RedisResp.RespParseResult.BytesConsumed
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of bytes consumed during parsing.
member.value: The count of bytes that were processed from the input buffer.

member.name: M:RedisResp.RespParseResult.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The parsed message object.
The raw RESP data string.
The number of bytes consumed during parsing.
The raw bytes from bulk string content.

member.name: T:RedisResp.RespVersionEnum
member.summary: Represents the version of the Redis Serialization Protocol (RESP) used for a message.
member.remarks: RESP2 is the original protocol version, while RESP3 introduces additional data types and enhanced capabilities for modern Redis communication.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespVersionEnum.RESP2
member.summary: RESP2 protocol version (original). Supports: SimpleString, Error, Integer, BulkString, Array, Null.

member.name: F:RedisResp.RespVersionEnum.RESP3
member.summary: RESP3 protocol version (enhanced). Supports all RESP2 types plus: Double, Boolean, BigNumber, BlobError, VerbatimString, Map, Set, Attribute, Push.

member.name: T:RedisResp.SeverityEnum
member.summary: Message severity.

member.name: F:RedisResp.SeverityEnum.Debug
member.summary: Debug messages.

member.name: F:RedisResp.SeverityEnum.Info
member.summary: Informational messages.

member.name: F:RedisResp.SeverityEnum.Warn
member.summary: Warning messages.

member.name: F:RedisResp.SeverityEnum.Error
member.summary: Error messages.

member.name: F:RedisResp.SeverityEnum.Alert
member.summary: Alert messages.

member.name: F:RedisResp.SeverityEnum.Critical
member.summary: Critical messages.

member.name: F:RedisResp.SeverityEnum.Emergency
member.summary: Emergency messages.
